citeinfo.origin: New York State Department of Environmental Conservation
citeinfo.title: AA and AAs Watersheds - New York State (NYSDEC)

pubinfo.publish: New York State Department of Environmental Conservation

descript.abstract: AA and AAs classified watersheds in New York State
descript.purpose: This dataset is provided as an approximation of the drainage areas of water bodies classified as AA and AAs in Title 6 of the Official Compilation of Codes, Rules and Regulations of the State of New York (6NYCRR) Part 800 et seq. and their tributaries. The information contained in this dataset is provisional and is subject to change based on field verification of draft watershed boundary delineations and/or change in waterbody classification.
descript.supplinf: These data should be considered as a resource intended to provide approximate locations of watershed boundaries associated with AA and AAs classified waterbodies and their tributaries. Accuracy and precision of this product are limited by positional accuracy and precision of source data, the limitations of GIS-based descriptions of topographical features, as well as man-made drainage controls due to urbanization. In complex conditions field verification of boundaries may be required to satisfy eligibility requirements set forth in Part I.D. of the SPDES General Permit for Construction Activity (GP-0-10-001).

idinfo.useconst: 1. The NYS DEC asks to be credited in derived products. 2. Secondary Distribution of the data is not allowed. 3. Any documentation provided is an integral part of the data set. Failure to use the documentation in conjunction with the digital data constitutes misuse of the data. 4. Although every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of information, errors may be reflected in the data supplied. The user must be aware of data conditions and bear responsibility for the appropriate use of the information with respect to possible errors, original map scale, collection methodology, currency of data, and other conditions.

cntorgp.cntorg: New York State Department of Environmental Conservation

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

procstep.procdesc: AA and AAs waterbodies were extracted from a shapefile of water quality classifications published 7/10/2007 by NYS Department of Environmental Conservation, Division of Water, Bureau of Flood Protection and Dam Safety. A subset of watersheds associated with AA and AAs classified waterbodies was selected from Digital Data Drainage Basins for New York (Revision 1.0), a provisional dataset published 2002 by USGS Troy, New York. Extents of watersheds provided in the USGS dataset were edited by Christina Falk, General Permits, Division of Water, NYSDEC, to exclude areas downstream of the AA and AAs water bodies and their tributaries using contours from USGS 7.5 minute topographic images, orthoimagery and digital elevation models. Areas and perimeters of edited polygons were recalculated using the ArcMap v 9.2 editor field calculator.
The dataset was projected from NAD 27 UTM Zone 18N to NAD83 UTM Zone 18N.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

distinfo.resdesc: AA and AAs Watersheds - New York State (NYSDEC)
distinfo.distliab: The New York State Department of Environmental Conservation (NYSDEC) provides these geographic data "as is". NYSDEC makes no guarantee or warranty concerning the accuracy of information contained in the geographic data. NYSDEC further makes no warranty, either expressed or implied, regarding the condition of the product or its fitness for any particular purpose. The burden for determining fitness for use lies entirely with the user. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at NYSDEC, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. NYSDEC shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.
